alert.note: Alert for Gallatin (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 13 at 2:50PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Gallatin County through 315 PM MDT... At 249 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of West Yellowstone, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... West Yellowstone and Yellowstone Village. This includes the following highways... Highway 191 between mile markers 5 and 10. Highway 287 between mile markers 7 and 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall may also lead to minor localized flooding and debris flow down steep slopes. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
